title: data-marking
description: CACAO data marking definition objects contain detailed information about a specific data marking. Data markings typically represent handling or sharing requirements and are applied via the markings property in a playbook.

type.description: The type of data marking being used. The value for this property MUST come from the 'data-marking-type-ov' vocabulary.

spec_version.description: The version of the specification used to represent this data marking definition. The value of this property MUST be '1.1' to represent the version of this specification.

id.description: A value that uniquely identifies the data marking definition.

name.description: A name used to identify this data marking.

description.description: More details, context, and possibly an explanation about what this data marking does and tries to accomplish.

created_by.description: An ID that represents the entity that created this data marking. The ID MUST represent a STIX 2.1+ identity object.

created.description: The time at which this data marking was originally created. The creator can use any time it deems most appropriate as the time the data marking was created, but it MUST be precise to the nearest millisecond (exactly three digits after the decimal place in seconds). The created property MUST NOT be changed.

modified.description: Data markings MUST NOT be versioned. This property MUST always equal the timestamp of the created property.

revoked.description: A boolean that identifies if the creator deems that this data marking is no longer valid. The default value is 'false'. Processing of data that has been previously shared with an associated data marking that is subsequently revoked is unspecified and dependent on the implementation of the consuming software.

valid_from.description: The time from which this data marking is considered valid. If omitted, the data marking is valid at all times or until the timestamp defined by 'valid_until'.

valid_until.description: The time at which this data marking SHOULD no longer be considered a valid marking definition. If the valid_until property is omitted, then there is no constraint on the latest time for which the data marking is valid. This property MUST be greater than the timestamp in the 'valid_from' property if the 'valid_from' property is defined.

labels.description: An optional set of terms, labels, or tags associated with this data marking. The values may be user, organization, or trust-group defined and their meaning is outside the scope of this specification.

external_references.description: An optional list of external references for this data marking.

marking_extensions.description: This property defines the extensions that are in use on this data marking. The key for each entry in the dictionary MUST be an identifier that uniquely identifies the extension (see section 9.8 for more information on identifiers). The value for each key is a JSON object that can contain the structure as defined in the extension definition's schema property.
